page.title: 06Farming-Fodder
page.content: Cattle graze in the fields in summer but sheep are often out all the year round.Winter feed is either{hay or {silage}but in recent years more people have started to turn to silage in round bales and stored the bales in plastic bags.Silage is not so dependent on dry weather,It makes storage easier and the silage is better for milk cows.Perhaps in a few years time{hay making will}be a thing of the past. Fields are often re-sown and fertilised both by muckspreading and chemical fertilisers.This means that {wild flowers are not so common}in the meadows. Hay and bagged feed are often bought in from local suppliers and{straw}is always bought in as no grain is grown locally.
